intro: Pentaphragma grandiflorum, commonly known as the broadleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring a sprawling or prostrate growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually fleshy and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. The species is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is part of the Amaranthaceae family.
